summary: A letter from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to an Assistant United States Attorney regarding compliance with a grand jury subpoena dated February 5, 2019. The firm is producing supplemental materials related to the case Giuffre v. Maxwell and requests confidential treatment under various legal provisions.

persons.name: Judge McMahon
persons.context: Signed the Sealed Order (19 Misc. 149) dated April 9, 2019, which is referenced as the basis for the document production.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was directed to Boies Schiller Flexner LLP by the Assistant United States Attorney.

events.title: Sealed Order Signed
events.description: Judge McMahon signed Sealed Order 19 Misc. 149, which the letter states they are acting pursuant to.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the case Giuffre v. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS). The documents being produced are covered by this order.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 55 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001
keyFacts: Boies Schiller Flexner LLP is producing documents in response to a February 2019 grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The production includes materials from the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell, such as discovery, pleadings, and orders from 2015-2019.
The firm is making a strong, multi-layered request for confidential treatment of the produced materials under FOIA, Fed. R. Crim. P. 6(e), the Privacy Act, and 18 U.S.C. ยง 1905.
The letter indicates the grand jury investigation was active as of April 2019, with document production occurring on a rolling basis.
The document shows coordination between a private law firm (BSF) and federal prosecutors, with judicial oversight from Judge McMahon.
